b) g(x) =f(x + 1)−3 The d = −1 (since x −d = x −(−1) =x + 1) indicates a
horizontal translation of1 unit to the left and thec = −3 indicates a vertical
translation of3 units down. x′= x k + d = 1 1 + (−1) = 0 y′= a y+ c = 1(−2) +
(−3) = −5 Therefore, the resulting point is(0, −5) . c) g(x) =−f(2x) The a = −1
indicates a reflection in thex-axis and thek = 2indicates a horizontal
compression by a factor of1/2. x′= x k + d = 1 2 + 0 = 1 2 y′= a y+ c = (−1)(−2)
